page.title: 05Cliffe Marshes
page.content: The large areas of marsh land lying to the north of the village were once covered by a tidal sea & Cliffe was actually situated at the sea.Hence its early association as a port of some note & its survival in the form of street names,e.g.Wharf Lane.But by the mid-(13th much of the area had altered as a result of changes in the course of the Thames & Medway & the marshes had become permanently reclaimed.Modern alterations have been the removal of large amounts of sand and gravel for the building industry and the subsequent flooding of the pits. the area is now a patchwork of marshes, ditches and flooded pits.
